Azure.ResourceManager.ResourceProvisioni.description: The provisioning state of a resource type.

version.description: Version of the control plane components

console.description: Shows the cluster web console information

api.description: Shows the cluster API server profile

fips.description:
Enable FIPS mode for the cluster
When set to true, `etcdEncryption` must be set to true

etcdEncryption.description:
Enables customer ETCD encryption, set during creation
When set to true, `platform.etcdEncryptionSetId` must be set

issuerUrl.description:
URL for the OIDC provider to be used for authentication
to authenticate against user Azure cloud account

externalAuth.description:
Configuration to override the openshift-oauth-apiserver inside cluster
This changes user login into the cluster to external provider

version.description: Version of the control plane components

ConsoleProfile.description: Configuration of the cluster web console

url.description: The cluster web console URL endpoint

DnsProfile.description: DNS contains the DNS settings of the cluster

baseDomain.description: BaseDomain is the base DNS domain of the cluster.

baseDomainPrefix.description:
BaseDomainPrefix is the unique name of the cluster representing the OpenShift's cluster name.
BaseDomainPrefix is the name that will appear in the cluster's DNS, provisioned cloud providers resources

DnsProfileUpdate.description: DNS contains the DNS settings of the cluster

name.description: The name of the external auth client

authClientNamespace.description: The namespace of the external auth client

enabled.description: This can be set during cluster creation only to ensure there is no openshift-oauth-apiserver in cluster

externalAuths.description: This can only be set as a day-2 resource on a separate endpoint to provide a self-managed auth service

tuningConfigs.description:
Tuning configs, TODO provide meaningful explanation
TuningConfig is a list of references to ConfigMaps containing serialized
Tuned resources to define the tuning configuration to be applied to
nodes in the NodePool.
Each ConfigMap must have a single key named "tuned" whose value is the
JSON or YAML of a serialized Tuned or PerformanceProfile.

networkType.description: The main controller responsible for rendering the core networking components

values.name: OVNKubernetes
values.description: THE OVN network plugin for the OpenShift cluster

podCidr.description:
The CIDR of the pod IP addresses
example: 10.128.0.0/14

serviceCidr.description:
The CIDR block for assigned service IPs,
example: 172.30.0.0/16

machineCidr.description:
from which to assign machine IP addresses,
example: 10.0.0.0/16

hostPrefix.description: Network host prefix which is defaulted to 23 if not specified.

values.name: OVNKubernetes

min.description: The minimum number of nodes in the node pool

max.description: The maximum number of nodes in the node pool

min.description: The minimum number of nodes in the node pool

max.description: The maximum number of nodes in the node pool

subnetId.description: The resourceId for the subnet used by the workers

vmSize.description:
The VM size according to the documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/sizes

diskSizeGB.description: The OS disk size in GB

diskStorageAccountType.description:
The type of the disc storage account
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disks-types

availabilityZone.description:
The availability zone for the node pool.
Please read the documentation to see which regions support availability zones
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/availability-zones/az-overview

encryptionAtHost.description: Whether the worker machines should be encrypted at host

discEncryptionSetId.description:
Disk Encryption Set ID that will be used for ecnryption the Nodes disks
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disk-encryption-overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disk-encryption

replicas.description: The number of worker nodes, it cannot be used together with autoscaling

autoScaling.description: Representation of a autoscaling in a node pool.

tuningConfigs.description:
Tuning configs, TODO provide meaningful explanation
TuningConfig is a list of references to ConfigMaps containing serialized
Tuned resources to define the tuning configuration to be applied to
nodes in the NodePool.
Each ConfigMap must have a single key named "tuned" whose value is the
JSON or YAML of a serialized Tuned or PerformanceProfile.

OutboundType.description: The outbound routing strategy used to provide your cluster egress to the internet.

managedResourceGroup.description: Resource group to put cluster resources

subnetId.description: ResourceId for the subnet used by the control plane

preconfiguredNsgs.description: Specifies whether subnets are pre-attached with an NSG

etcdEncryptionSetId.description:
The id of the disk encryption set to be used for etcd.
Configure this when `etcdEncryption` is set to true
Is used the https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/customer-managed-keys-overview

audiences.description: The audience of the token issuer

channelGroup.description: ChannelGroup is the name of the set to which this version belongs. Each version belongs to only a single set.

availableUpgrades.description: AvailableUpgrades is a list of version names the current version can be upgraded to.

id.description: ID is the unique identifier of the version.
